bullets.text: U.S. pauses domestic asylum applications; Trump signals broader migration restrictions after D.C. shooting, escalating anti-migrant posture and legal battles ahead.
Hong Kong high-rise fire death toll reaches 128; officials had year-old warnings, highlighting building safety, enforcement and governance failures.
Andriy Yermak resigns as Zelensky’s chief of staff amid corruption scandal, injecting uncertainty into wartime governance and Western support coordination.
U.S. stocks notch best Thanksgiving week since 2008; late rally lifts S&P 500 near records, led by Big Tech outperformance.
Consumers enter holidays with spending plans intact; major retailers project confidence while small businesses face margin pressure and competition.
Airbus requests checks and modifications on ~6,000 A320-family jets after intense solar radiation found to corrupt critical flight data; airlines expect limited disruption.
CME halted futures due to a data-center cooling issue before resuming; incident spotlights infrastructure fragility in core market plumbing.
India’s GDP grew 8.2% in Q3 FY25, beating forecasts despite tariff pressures; domestic demand and manufacturing remained strong.
Baidu emerges as a leading domestic AI chip supplier in China, seeking to fill Nvidia’s gap amid U.S. export controls.
Europe pushes to develop large rare earths finds, urging accelerated permitting and financing to reduce dependence on China.
H5N1 bird flu shows surprising heat tolerance, raising concerns about persistence through warmer seasons and expanded host range.
Recognition of LATE, a distinct dementia, is reshaping understanding of cognitive decline trajectories and complicating Alzheimer’s diagnoses and trials.
Coffee prices are at multi-decade highs, pressuring consumer budgets and food-service margins amid supply constraints.
Meesho’s $606 million IPO marks India’s first major e-commerce listing, with SoftBank remaining a shareholder.
Video appears to show Israeli forces killing two Palestinians after surrender in West Bank, risking further international condemnation and escalation.
